title: Is Warren Buffet right about 'The Intelligent Investor' being the best book on investing? Is there something better? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is a must read. Investing is a cumulative learning game. You cannot learn it all and the start. You learn and invest and build and experience the ups and downs. You discover the website you have been reading is running a pump and dump and someone else is just there to look smart and scare people. You will be an investor like no other. I rented a Netflix movie, bought 100 shares and repeated the practice a few times and it became my first 7 bagger. 700% on my first investment. The subsequent has been less but I didn’t look at it as becoming a $300K position when I started. I have had many not work out as well.

Depends. If you think of investing as a hobby read everything you can and this is one of the classics. But remember it was written in 1949 and a whole lot of things have changed since then. If you think of investing as a chore and something that you want to do right but not spend a ton of time on just listen to Buffets advice and buy index funds. If I were recommending a single book I’d find one by Jack Bogle. “Common Sense on Mutual Funds: New Imperatives for the Intelligent Investor” comes to mind.
